name: Zhijian Liu
content: Zhijian Liu Zhijian Liu zhijian [at] ucsd (dot) edu I am a research scientist at NVIDIA and an incoming assistant professor at UCSD. I finished my PhD at MIT, advised by Song Han. My research focuses on efficient machine learning and systems. I am recruiting PhD students from HDSI/CSE in the upcoming application cycle. I am also always looking for talented research interns to join our group! If you're interested, please fill out this form. Email  / Google Scholar  / LinkedIn  / GitHub News I commit 1 hour every week to provide guidance, suggestions, and/or mentorships for students from underrepresented groups or whoever is in need. Please fill in this form if you are interested. I was selected as one of the Rising Stars in Data Science by UChicago and UCSD! I was selected as one of the Rising Stars in ML and Systems by MLCommons! I was awarded Qualcomm Innovation Fellowship. Thanks, Qualcomm! Our SPVCNN++ won the first place in nuScenes LiDAR Segmentation Challenge. Our HAQ has been integrated into Intel's OpenVINO toolkit.
